txt.en: 'I think it is time we brought these issues to Stanric himself. Come, let us seek an audience with him. Perhaps we will catch him away from Sithric for once.'

'How frustrating! If Sithric represents the king's wishes, I have no desire to be a subject of Th√©oden any longer. Our king was once a great man, but now....'

Gadda gives a quick glance around him, then lowers his voice.

'I must be careful what I say from now on, I think. Sithric's men are everywhere.'
'Perhaps we can make some headway at last. The situation in Stangard is growing too dire.'
The problems of Stangard are clear, and it is time to try to change the way the settlement is run.
Address your observations of Stangard's hardships to its leaders
Gadda is outside of the Mead Hall in Stangard.\n\nYou should speak to Gadda to gain audience with the leaders of Stangard.
Gadda is outside the Mead Hall in Stangard.\n\nYou should speak with Gadda regarding the council with Stanric.
